Articles.Content:
Holy cow, there's a lot of requests all of the sudden! ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif) I'll render each in order.

> 
> If i will send a craft is want you to render after 1st stage separation would it be possible

Yes, it's perfectly possible. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Holy cow, there's a lot of requests all of the sudden! ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif) I'll render each in order.
> Yes, it's perfectly possible. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

After all, your work is mindblowing ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Could you dump some links for good tutorials that can make renders like your's happen for those wanting to learn to mass produce their own Blender renders and not have to bug you in the future? Thanks and keep up the work!

> 
> After all, your work is mindblowing ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> Could you dump some links for good tutorials that can make renders like your's happen for those wanting to learn to mass produce their own Blender renders and not have to bug you in the future? Thanks and keep up the work!

Sure! Hell, I'll make a tutorial specifically for renders like mine. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

For now:

[http://cgcookie.com/blender/cgc-courses/blender-basics-introduction-for-beginners/](http://cgcookie.com/blender/cgc-courses/blender-basics-introduction-for-beginners/)

[http://www.blender.org/support/tutorials/](http://www.blender.org/support/tutorials/)

[http://www.creativebloq.com/3d-tips/blender-tutorials-1232739](http://www.creativebloq.com/3d-tips/blender-tutorials-1232739)

And of course, you can always search "Blender Tutorials" in the web browser of your choice. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Sure! Hell, I'll make a tutorial specifically for renders like mine. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> For now:
> 
> [http://cgcookie.com/blender/cgc-courses/blender-basics-introduction-for-beginners/](http://cgcookie.com/blender/cgc-courses/blender-basics-introduction-for-beginners/)
> 
> [http://www.blender.org/support/tutorials/](http://www.blender.org/support/tutorials/)
> 
> [http://www.creativebloq.com/3d-tips/blender-tutorials-1232739](http://www.creativebloq.com/3d-tips/blender-tutorials-1232739)
> 
> And of course, you can always search "Blender Tutorials" in the web browser of your choice. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Thanks for the links!

Btw here is my failed 1100 sample render ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

![Fs132bG.png](http://i.imgur.com/Fs132bG.png)

Would you be willing to make a render of this:

![p3Ox9v9.png](http://i.imgur.com/p3Ox9v9.png)

In 1080x1920 (HQ)?

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/zkyqh651elz2lud/MU%20MSS-2%20%27Guardian%27.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/zkyqh651elz2lud/MU%20MSS-2%20%27Guardian%27.craft?dl=0)

Also, I'm really tempted to try doing this once I get my new PC built later this year. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Hey, I'm willing to help out in setting up scenes and such for rendering to ease the load (lots of requests you seem to be receiving), but my machine is not powerful enough for 1100 renders.

Are you, or is anyone, interested in setting up a makeshift render cluster? It's very easy to do, as all Blender distributions have an addon called Network Render. All we need, though, is a master for clients to connect to and at least 3 slaves. (The slave computers don't have to be dedicated to Blender; they can run Blender in the background or something.)

EDIT: Actually, netrender doesn't seem to split frames into smaller chunks. So I'll just go with sending blend files..

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-01T23:28:18Z" title="03/01/2015 11:28  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 1, 2015</time> by longbyte1**

> 
> Holy cow, there's a lot of requests all of the sudden! ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif) I'll render each in order.
> Yes, it's perfectly possible. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

May have been the update I released, which makes it an actual Blender addon. Let me know how it's working for you!

Also in the update, the menu lets you select all parts in the same stage as the currently selected parts. Hopefully that would be useful for that one request.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-02T04:54:40Z" title="03/02/2015 04:54  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 2, 2015</time> by Dasoccerguy**

Umm.. Starwhip, not to sound rude, but when are the renders going to be finished?

Thanks in advance!![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) I really like your work, and would really want to know if everything is going well.

(P.S: I also posted so that the thread won't be lost. Sorry..)

> 
> Umm.. Starwhip, not to sound rude, but when are the renders going to be finished?
> Thanks in advance!![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) I really like your work, and would really want to know if everything is going well.
> 
> (P.S: I also posted so that the thread won't be lost. Sorry..)

Don't worry, soon! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I've had a ton of work to do, sorry for the delay. It's done now. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I hope nobody hates me.

> 
> Don't worry, soon! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)I've had a ton of work to do, sorry for the delay. It's done now. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I hope nobody hates me.

Oh, that seems good to know! I was a bit worried that the thread was going to disappear because it lost activity after a while.

Thanks for your patience, despite the burdens!

Good luck on your work, by the way! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-06T13:32:47Z" title="03/06/2015 01:32  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 6, 2015</time> by Columbia**

Hello can you render this

Skylark-5A

A civilian version of the Skylark VTOL Warfighter

I want it to be 1600X900

[http://kerbalx.com/ouion/Skylark-5A](http://kerbalx.com/ouion/Skylark-5A)
Sure thing! Added to queue.

> 
> Sure thing! Added to queue.

I'm not trying to sound rude, but I couldn't help but notice that my request was ignored. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

> 
> I'm not trying to sound rude, but I couldn't help but notice that my request was ignored. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

I had your request in my computer's version of the queue, but I seem to have misplaced the file. Don't worry, I haven't forgotten!
oops, its 1600x900 resolution and about 500-1000 pixels

> 
> I had your request in my computer's version of the queue, but I seem to have misplaced the file. Don't worry, I haven't forgotten!

Thanks! Sorry for bringing it up, but I'm curious to see how it turns out. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Starwhip, Sorry about this, but I'll just "bump" the thread to keep it from being lost despite still being active. 

I was worried that it might get too "old" and be lost, even though It's still active.

Good luck on the renders, by the way! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Hey,

Any ETA of the renders?

Also not letting this sink too much. Love your work!
